pr_title: docs: fix some typo in the deploying-to-openshift doc

timeline.message: docs: fix some typo in the deploying-to-openshift doc

timeline.bodyText: We usually keep the lowercase extension name when in backticks.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -42,7 +42,7 @@ Quarkus offers the ability to automatically generate OpenShift resources based o
 The OpenShift extension is actually a wrapper extension that brings together the link:deploying-to-kubernetes[kubernetes] and link:container-image#s2i[container-image-s2i]
 extensions with sensible defaults so that it's easier for the user to get started with Quarkus on OpenShift.
 
-When we added the `openshift` extension to the command line invocation above, the following dependency was added to the `pom.xml`
+When we added the `OpenShift` extension to the command line invocation above, the following dependency was added to the `pom.xml`

replies.bodyText: I thought this only applies when the full artefact is in use as quarkus-openshift  extension.
replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText: I would either remove the backticks and have it properly cased or keep the backticks and keep it lowercase.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Great - here is the followup PR #8046. Good to know this :-)
replies.author: machi1990
